    • Field Detail

      • inputEncoders

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> inputEncoders
        InputEncoder table. If the encoder is the same for all inputs, then this table should contain only one key-value pair. Key is an number associated with the encoders. Values are the encoders for the input.

      • inputRange

        private java.util.ArrayList<int[]> inputRange
        The range of the input.

      • inputSize

        private int inputSize
        The size of the input.

      • stateEncoders

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> stateEncoders
        StateEncoder table. If the encoder is the same for all states, then this table should contain only one key-value pair. Key is an number associated with the encoders. Values are the encoders for the state.

      • states

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,ostrowski.OstrowskiAutomaton.OstrowskiState> states
        Stores all the states in the automaton. Key is the encoding of the state.

      • putTransition

        public boolean putTransition(int state,
                             int[] input,
                             int dest)
        Add a transition to the automaton.
        Parameters:
        state - the encoding of the origin of the transition.
        input - the input of the transition.
        dest - the destination of the transition.
        Returns:
        true if the transition is successfully added.
